results.title: Till human voices wake us
results.creator_credit: Michael Petroni, David Redman, Nigel Odell, Dean Murphy, Shana Levine, Thomas Augsberger, Matthias Emcke, Cinemedia, AFFC, Globe Film Company, Entertainment Finance Group and Instinct Entertainment
results.brief_description: Lyrical and moody, a reflective piece about first love, love lost and memories. Initially set in the 1960s in a small Victorian country town, a teenage boy returns home from boarding school to his father, the town doctor, and his best friend Silvy. On the night of the town dance Sam and Silvy slip away to go for a swim, unfortunately with dire consequences. Twenty years later Sam (Guy Pearce), now a psychologist, returns to fulfil his father’s final wish to be buried in Genoa. He meets a strange woman called Ruby (Helena Bonham-Carter) on the train and she proves to be a link for Sam back to his Silvy and his lost emotions. Written and directed by Michael Petroni in his feature film debut with original music composed by Dale Cornelius. Cast includes Frank Gallacher, Lindley Joyner, Brooke Harman.

results.title: Tiling walls
results.brief_description: Demonstrates using a jury stick to compare alternative layouts, application of moisture membrane for a waterproof substrate, mixing mortar and floating a vertical bed, and cutting and shaping tiles. This program is a companion to “Setting Ceramic Tile” (The Taunton Press, 1987) and page references appear in the corners of the screen.

results.title: Tikki Tikki Tembo
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: In this charming old Chinese fairy tale, we learn why Chinese parents today give their children little short names instead of great long names. This fable with a moral will delight viewers young and old.

results.title: Tightrope dancer
results.brief_description: Vali Myers is larger than life, or perhaps it’s better to say as large as life. An extraordinary artist and adventurer, her work and philosophies reflect a wild primal spirit that no country or society can contain. At 59, Vali moves between the wilds of her Italian home near Salerno and a hip, limousined, sophisticated life in New York. A leading dancer with a modern dance company at the age of 18, she left Australia for Europe to become a street waif, passing through opium addiction and finally finding relief and peace in her own art. Her flamboyance and her desire to live to the fullest has led her to become a sought after personality.

results.title: Tigerland [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Arnon Milchan, Steven Haft, Beau Flynn, Regency Enterprises, New Regency Pictures, Kirch Media and Haft Entertainment
results.brief_description: Tigerland is the name of a military base in the United States used for the training of recruits before they are to be sent to fight in the war in Vietnam. The film follows the recruits as they are increasingly pushed to the edge of their physical and mental capabilities by a dehumanising military regime convinced that only by brutalising the men will they be able to sufficiently face the terrors of the war ahead. Starring Colin Farrell as Roland Bozz, a young man whose independent spirit and questioning mind puts him immediately at odds with authority, “Tigerland” is a punishing but compelling view of army life. The actual war is in the background. It is as a study of masculinity, repressed sexuality and violence that the film is most effective. Usually known for bloated big-budget action films, director Schumacher has instead, in “Tigerland”, utilised hand-held camerawork, minimal special effects and a concentration on the performances of the actors to achieve his effects. As a late addition to the genre of Vietnam war film, “Tigerland” lacks the immediacy and hallucinatory contradictions of films such as “Apocalypse Now” or “The Deerhunter”: in many ways, for all its kinetic editing and camerawork, it is a traditional genre film. Nevertheless, the performances and the energetic direction ensures that it is both exciting and confronting.

results.title: Tiger shikar in India (D)
results.creator_credit: Ellis R. Duncan, Frank Ferrin and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description:
An American film man tells of a tiger shooting expedition in northern India. Describes the facilities for big game hunters, and shows shooting from the back of an elephant and from a hide in a tree.
WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellis R. Duncan, Frank Ferrin and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Tiger shikar (D)
results.brief_description:
Two tiger hunts in northern India. In the first, villagers go after a man-eater which threatens their safety, using b eaters, nets and spears to surround, trap and kill the tiger. In the second, big-game hunters from overseas, riding elephants and accompanied by beaters, shoot tigers for sport.
NB: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Tiger hunters
results.creator_credit: V. Goulin and Far Eastern Newsreel Studios
results.brief_description: Some of the tigers trained for Soviet circuses come from the Far East tiger country where they are trapped by groups of skilled hunters. The film shows the hunters, accompanied by dogs, trail their prey which, generally, prefer to elude rather than turn on their pursuers. After the dogs have cornered the tigers the hunters pin them down with forked branches.
